Description: A smaller integer type that can store whole numbers ranging from -32,768 to 32,767.
A standard integer type that can store whole numbers ranging from -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647.
A larger integer type that can store whole numbers ranging from -9,223,372,036,854,775,808 to 9,223,372,036,854,775,807.
A numeric type with user-defined precision (p) and scale (s).
A single-precision floating-point number.
A floating-point number.
Fixed-length character type. If the string is shorter than n characters, it will be padded with spaces.
Variable-length character type with a limit of n characters.
Variable-length character type with no specific limit.
Example: 'This can be a long piece of text.'

Description: Stores calendar dates (year, month, day).
Stores time of day without time zone information.
Stores both date and time without time zone information.
Stores both date and time with time zone information.
Stores a time span (interval between two timestamps).
Can hold one of three values: TRUE, FALSE or NULL.
You can define columns as arrays of any data type
Stores JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) data
Stores binary JSON data for faster processing.
Universally Unique Identifier; a 128-bit number used for unique identification.
Stores currency amounts with fixed fractional precision.
